head.supplied: 14th Mch '84 ¶ Memo No. 887 ¶ ¶ I beg to point out to the Govt Botanist that his memo of the 4th instant, respecting the giant todea fern presented to the St Petersburgh Botanic Gardens gives the cos...

div.p: P84/375, unit 22, VPRS 1163/P1 inward correspondence, VA 1123 Premier, Public Record Office, Victoria.

This letter was first registered as B84/2251 in the Chief Secretary's Department then referred to E. Thomas, Secretary to the Premier. See also M to T. Wilson, 4 March 1884, and M to T. Wilson, 18 March 1884 (in this edition as 94-03-18a). 14th Mch '84

I beg to point out to the Govt Botanist that his memo of the 4th instant, respecting the giant todea fern presented to the St Petersburgh Botanic Gardens gives the cost of the conveyance of the fern only as far as London; and to request that he will be good enough to state if he is aware what expenses, if any were incurred in transporting the plant thence to St Petersburgh, and if any how such expenses were defrayed.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
